description: glass; flat cover with slot in top; one Hebrew letter etched on each side of box; at bottom interior under glass divider (not removable):  crystal prizm, looped piece of slightly rusted iron, tan-grey rock of irregular shape with incised lines overall
text: This artist intends her tzedakah box to hold not only coins for charity, but symbols of what the giver should treasure above money.  The stone is from Galilee and represents earth, abundance and life.  The forged iron represents the gift of labor and the crystal represents the clarity of learning.   The coins come from China, Canada, the United States, Mexico, and Israel.
title: Reflection
